channel.title: I need help making commands work on quest tab

item.title: I need help making commands work on quest tab
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

I’m glad you actually tried, rather than people who just ask how to do it. You actually had logic in looking at the ID’s, but there’s a difference in what you want to do.

        /* Free Quests*/
        if (q1stage == -1) {
            sendQuest("@gre@::Commands", 7332);
        }

Okay, the “q#stage” is an int (integer). It’s a number that is set to make certain specifics happen. So as you can see, it’s saying “if quest stage is equal to one, then send the text ‘commands’ in green”. In this case, since im pretty sure you aren’t wanting this to have anything to do with quest stages, you can completely get rid of that if statement.

The “7332” is the sendQuest ID. This tells you on what line the text is going to be placed. On Silab’s client, if you scroll over a quest it will show the sendQuest ID in the top left corner.

Action buttons are NOT related to sendQuest Id’s at all. I noticed that you used 7332 as an action button, thinking that it would create an effect if you had that set. Action buttons have different Id’s all on their own. If you click anything on an interface that is clickable it should print the action button Id in your run.bat. It should say something about case 185 then it will show you the action button.

Now, by setting up what you’re wanting, you’re going to just use this:

        /* Free Quests*/
            sendQuest("@gre@::Commands", 7332);
            sendQuest("@gre@::Rules", 7333);
            sendQuest("@gre@::Updates", 7334);
            sendQuest("@gre@We Still Have ::Teampk", 7336);

That will give you the list of what you wanted in the quest tab. You don’t need the q#stage unless you’re using quest stages.

If you want to set it so that it does something by clicking it you’re going to have to click one of the quests and check your run.bat. See what the id is and put it like you did in here:

case 7333: if (teleblock == true) { // Made by Mod Allstar sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); } else { customCommand("rules"); // made by Mod Allstar } break;

Just replace the 7333 with the action button Id you retrieved from your run.bat.

By the way, you don’t need this part:

                if (teleblock == true) { // Made by Mod Allstar
                    sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting.");

In that previous line, considering you aren’t teleporting anywhere. So it should just look like this:

            case ####:
                    customCommand("rules"); // made by Mod Allstar
                break;

So post any further questions, or feel free to PM me if you need further assistance.

BTW I HAVE NO RESPONCIBILITY OVER WHAT HAPPENS TO YOUR CLIENT.JAVA. So if you mess up and get 100 errors on your compiler it’s not my fault whatsoever. Make sure you make a copy of your client.java when you’re at an intermediate level of coding a private server. Soon enough you won’t have to deal with copies.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help making commands work on quest tab

item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Mod Foxen:

Uh… So this is saying that if you have teleblock on then you can’t open the rules interface? Ehhuh

That has nothing to do with it working or not. I just copied and pasted my other one from my emotes tab…I never edited it because I am testing it. If you’re not going to freaking help me then don’t post retarded replies. You posted a dumb reply on my other topic too.

item.title: I need help making commands work on quest tab
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Ok so This is what I made so far on my quest tab: /* Free Quests*/ if (q1stage == -1) { sendQuest("@gre@::Commands", 7332); } if (q1stage >= 1) { sendQuest("@gre@::Commands", 7332); } if (q1stage == 0) { sendQuest("@gre@::Commands", 7332); } if (q2stage == -1) { sendQuest("@gre@::Rules", 7333); } if (q2stage >= 1) { sendQuest("@gre@::Rules", 7333); } if (q2stage == 0) { sendQuest("@gre@::Rules", 7333); } if (q3stage == -1) { sendQuest("@gre@::Updates", 7334); } if (q3stage >= 1) { sendQuest("@gre@::Updates", 7334); } if (q3stage == 0) { sendQuest("@gre@::Updates", 7334); } if (q4stage == -1) { sendQuest("@gre@We Still Have ::Teampk", 7336); } if (q4stage >= 1) { sendQuest("@gre@We Still Have ::Teampk", 7336); } if (q4stage == 0) { sendQuest("@gre@We Still Have ::Teampk", 7336); }

I wanted to make it so when you click ::rules, or: if (q2stage == -1) { sendQuest("@gre@::Rules", 7333); } if (q2stage >= 1) { sendQuest("@gre@::Rules", 7333); } if (q2stage == 0) { sendQuest("@gre@::Rules", 7333); }

It opens up the rules interface, so I created this: case 7333: if (teleblock == true) { // Made by Mod Allstar sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); } else { customCommand("rules"); // made by Mod Allstar } break;

And I put that where all of my commands on the emote tabs were. The ones on the emote tabs work, but I need more on the quest tabs. I’ve seen it done on the quest tabs before, I just need to know how because I thought this would work, but I guess I was wrong.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making commands work on quest tab
